metadata.Title: CVE-2017-0901 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
RubyGems version 2.6.12 and earlier fails to validate specification names, allowing a maliciously crafted gem to potentially overwrite any file on the filesystem.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0901` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> ruby{1.9.1,2.0,2.3} and jruby ship an embedded rubygems.

criterions.comment: jruby: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10').
